column4: Anyone want to help me with installing ndiswrapper without using apt-get?
Its all good.
Working on building ndiswarpper-1.4rc4, but it says I need "source". Looks like thats 5 CSs of information. Anyway I could build it without the source?
*CD
Switching from windows... need help installing ndiswrapper so I can use Ubuntu to connect to the internet with a wireless card...
what chipset?
You mean the wireless card?
dang. I had it written down, but I verified and its compatable.
Nope. Can't get internet on linux box because the card doesn't work.
That'll involve me rebooting and all that. Hold up, lemme look it up
If you know off hand, is Linksys WMP54G
Broadcom, I think.
No wired card, and that'd involve running a cable down three stories.
I read over the FAQ, and it says that I need the Kernel Source. Where do I pick that up?
you need the kernel source headers if you're compiling it
Where do I find the kernel source headers?
are you sure it isn't installed already
I'm pretty sure, Mustard5: no internet connection.
Where's it found? /lib/modules/kernel/build?
you'd have to download them
Yes... where do I find them?
you need to find a way to wire your computer in for a minute
I can download in windows, burn onto a CD, transport that way.
No network card. Can't wire.
